snippet: The Bloomberg administration plans to replace most traditional towing with a program affixing wheel clamps onto vehicles whose owners owe over $350 in outstanding fines.
abstract: Bloomberg administration announces plans to move away from towing cars that violate city parking rules, and to return to so-called booting program, affixing wheel clamp to any offending vehicle whose owner owes over $350 in outstanding fines; boot would be remotely released upon payment of fines, process that could drastically reduce the time that drivers have to wait before getting vehicle back.
lead_paragraph: The Bloomberg administration plans to replace most traditional towing with a program affixing wheel clamps onto vehicles whose owners owe over $350 in outstanding fines.

headline.seo: To Press Drivers to Pay Fines, New York Reverts To Its Days of Hobbling
headline.main: City Reverts to Its Days of Hobbling
headline.print_headline: To Collect Fines, City Is Again Clamping Down (On Scofflaws’ Wheels)
